column3: ILO-ITC Decent Jobs for Youth Training
column6: This course aims to addressed issues related to promoting decent jobs for youth in rural areas, by providing an in-depth understanding of the context of rural employment in developing countries, outlining the particular challenges faced by rural youth, and young women in particular. It explored the various policy elements and intervention approaches that are needed to support rural youths.The course is of particular interest to policy-makers, planners, technical officials of relevant ministries, and other technical experts from relevant institutions. In particular, the course caters for policy advisors and practitioners from ministries of labour and employment, agriculture and rural development, economy and planning, other sectoral ministries, social partners, researchers and policy analysts from international, regional and national organizations, academia and donor organizations, particularly those who are active in the area of rural development. A gender-balanced participation is sought

column3: Regional Seminar under the Youth NEET programme
column6: The seminar provided a thorough understanding of the challenges faced by NEET youth and equipped representatives from ministries, employment services, and social partners with tools and policies to improve employment and education access.
